conclusion: Objects cast shadows A, B, C, and D; light source is from front-left
Light source moving to back-right changes angle and direction of light rays
Shadows will shift and possibly elongate with new angle of incidence
Shadow A (Apple) initially extends towards bottom-right
Shadow A will move to front-left and stretch towards top-left
Shadow B (Paper) is below and slightly to the right
Shadow B will shift to front-left and be more prominent towards top-left
Shadow C (Glass) is below the glass
Shadow C will move front-left and appear less distinct
Shadow D (Chicken Leg) is below and slightly left
Shadow D will extend more towards front-left
Shadows may elongate if angle becomes more acute
Apple and paper shadows could become longer
Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift positions towards front-left and likely elongate
